events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection, requesting to open a claim.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident following review of the reported car collision and relevant keywords.
An insurance agent with expertise in auto claims was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim promptly and efficiently.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Documents requested from the claimant include police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a completed accident statement form.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and insurance proof within the stipulated time.
Claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and assessing vehicle damages to determine liability and claim validity.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision fault and estimating repair costs for the claimant’s car damage.
Insurance company proposed a settlement amount covering all vehicular repair expenses and associated claim costs in full.
Customer responded with positive feedback appreciating the prompt response and clear communication throughout the claim process.
Final approval granted by claims department confirming the settlement offer and authorizing payment issuance to the claimant.
Payment was successfully issued to the customer’s bank account for the approved auto accident claim settlement amount.
Claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and finalizing all necessary claim documentation.
Claim documents and investigation files were archived for record keeping in compliance with company policy and regulatory requirements.
